comment.body:
I'm trying to see if the recent update to qtesla took care of some of these. Trying the `cmake -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=clang-9 -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DUSE_SANITIZER=Undefined -GNinja ..` command doesn't work for me: I don't have clang-9 (so I removed the option), and then it said:  `Manually-specified variables were not used by the project: USE_SANITIZER`.

@dstebila, can you rerun the sanitizer and let me know of the reported log? Thanks.

issue.title: Ensure Keccak in picnic has separate namespace
issue.body: Goal: PQClean algorithms referencing `KeccakP1600times4_PermuteAll_24rounds` should not accidentally "wind up" calling Picnic's implementation thereof

comment.body: Yes, all non-namespaced Keccak calls should refer to the code in `common/sha3`. What platform and optimizations (e.g., avx2, etc.) are you using? The Keccak code uses a lot of macros (functions and variants are defined by macros, sometimes implemented in C, sometimes in assembly), and I tried to namespace all of the picnic ones but maybe I missed a few (quite possible if I didn't test on the same platform w/ same opt as you). I'll investigate.

issue.title: addresses issue #666
issue.body: As discussed with @xvzcf. This exposes the `src/common` based Keccak used by Dilithium, Sphincs and Kyber in their AVX2 implementations and hides the Picnic variant.

comment.body: @christianpaquin This proposal goes beyond what you'd already done. However, the previous edits didn't "hide away" everything. This PR in particular does this _only_ with the symbol `KeccakP1600times4_PermuteAll_24rounds`. If we should do this for all "Picnic-based" Keccak symbols, that'd be good: Either I do it or you(r team) can do: Please just let me know. Without this change, the three PQClean algorithms mentioned above call into Picnic's Keccak -- which isn't ideal.

issue.title: Undefined behaviour in qTesla
issue.body:
When enabling clang's UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer using the build sequence
```
mkdir build && cd build
cmake -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=clang-9 -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DUSE_SANITIZER=Undefined -GNinja ..
ninja
```

            if 'SPHINCS' in sig_name and ('192f' in sig_name or '192s' in sig_name or '256f' in sig_name or '256s' in sig_name):
                pytest.skip('Skipping SPHINCS+ 192s and 256s tests on Windows AppVeyor builds')

>           [helpers.path_to_executable('test_sig'), sig_name],

comment.body: Sorry, I got confused about the issue.  I was running AddressSanitizer, not UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer.  Will re-run.

issue.title: Undefined behaviour in qTesla
issue.body:
When enabling clang's UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer using the build sequence
```
mkdir build && cd build
cmake -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=clang-9 -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DUSE_SANITIZER=Undefined -GNinja ..
ninja
```

issue.title: Ensure Keccak in picnic has separate namespace
issue.body: Goal: PQClean algorithms referencing `KeccakP1600times4_PermuteAll_24rounds` should not accidentally "wind up" calling Picnic's implementation thereof

comment.body: PR #705 should fix the picnic namespacing.
